intro: Phelipanche coelestis, commonly known as the blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that produces striking blue or violet flowers with a distinctive, sweet scent. The plant has a fibrous root system and thrives in well-drained soil. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It is closely related to other species in the Convolvulaceae family, known for their climbing habits and showy blooms.
